page.title: 14R. G. LANCELYN_GREEN
page.content: Rodger Lancelyn_Green was born in November 1918 in Norfolk. He tried various jobs such as acting, school master, book_seller and deputy librarian at Merton College, Oxford. His first love, writing, was not earning him any money. The first thing that he tried to publish was a "ghastly horror story" (his own words) for a boys' magazine printed in Dundee. The first proper work he tried to have published was a book of poetry in 1945. From 1946 he started taking literary work seriously. In 1950 he returned to the Wirral. Since then he has written almost 60 books, one being "The World's End" (a children's fantasy), he wrote mostly fantasies about dragons etc. Now aged 66 he has nearly ceased writting.
